intro: Brosimum lanciferum, commonly known as the Guatemalan rubber tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central America and parts of South America, particularly in tropical regions. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Its latex, similar to that of the rubber tree, has been used traditionally for various purposes. The species is also valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in its native habitat.
